A comprehensive set of activities for empowering unemployed Roma through coaching and mentorship services continued in 2017. 3 Mentors and 6 coaches were engaged in 12 municipalities to provide individual based support to unemployed persons who are most disadvantaged in the labour market. The outreach of this assistance was further extended in the second half of 2017 when 12 mentors were engaged to cover 18 municipalities. In the second half of 2017, when the programme actually started, in total 500 Roma and other vulnerable persons have been activated. Individual Employment Plans have been prepared for 258 persons, thereof 240 being persons of Roma ethnicity and 155 young persons up to 29 years old. As a result of the mentorship, so far 13 persons have been employed or self-employed and 13 other persons have participated in active labour market measures for improving their employability. The Community Works Programme tackles social exclusion on two fronts at once, offering unemployed people chance to gain valuable working experience and improve their professional skills while providing services for those who are most at risk of social exclusion. The specific activities target several groups of beneficiaries: pre-school children, elderly people, people and children with disabilities as well as citizens of rural areas who are entitled to receive health and/or educational services. The Community Works Programme has become part of the national employment strategy and is one of the active labor market measures of the Operational Plan for Employment. In 2017, 39 municipalities are supported through this measure. Currently, 466 unemployed people are delivering social services at 39 municipalities. Over 7,238 socially excluded people have felt the benefits, as each municipality launched schemes offering part-time job experiences in areas such as elderly care, early childhood development and supporting children and people with disabilities. Self-employment for people with disabilities helps to stimulate the creative and entrepreneurial skills among unemployed people with disabilities. Each newly created start-up has a chance to immediately employ two additional people to support smooth business operations and help overcome some of the barriers. Established companies have been further supported with mentoring support, for a period of one more year. Since the open call was announced, a total of 74 candidates have applied for the measure. To date, 34 businesses have been registered. These 34 new businesses have created additional 9 new jobs. UNDP is working in close partnership with civil society organizations and associations of people with disabilities to design workable models for the economic inclusion of people with disabilities.

- No. of analysis focused on Roma and persons with disabilities employability

comment.narrative: - Lack of focused analysis related to inclusive labour markets, focused on Roma and persons with disabilities
- Analysis focused on Roma and persons with disabilities employability initiated

Additional analysis with focus on the inclusive labour market have been initiated by the Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation (SDC), with the aim to collect findings and to generate recommendations for actions that can address the unemployment challenges of the most vulnerable groups in a more effective and efficient way. In that sense, several analyses have been launched. These include among others impact evaluation of eight active labour market measures, development of a policy paper on vulnerability of Roma employment, development of supporting schemes for work engagement of persons with disabilities, assessment of the capacities of the business support organizations to support employment of vulnerable groups, development of territorial employment plans and partnerships for the municipalities of Gostivar and Shuto Orizari, elaboration of an integrated case management for employment and social welfare users, and preparation of a policy paper on employment models for the informal waste collectors. Recommendations derived from these analyses are expected to give clear guidelines to promote employment generation and private sector development among the population groups that suffer particularly severe labour market disadvantages e.g. Roma community, people with disability and youth.

comment.narrative: 1. Baseline: 0 2. Baseline: 0 3.Baseline: 0 6. Simulated damages and losses in the Upper Vardar River Basin (to be defined in the flood risk management plan) 9. Baseline: 0 10. Baseline: To be defined with an entry survey
As the project was launched at the end of 2017, no targets were set.

A new multi-year multi-million flood risk mitigation/DRR programme was successfully launched to instigate transformational change in managing floods in Polog – one of country’s most risk sensitive regions. As part of its preparatory stage, interdisciplinary expertise was used for the preparation of a basin-scale flood risk management plans in line with the objectives of the EU Floods Directive and DRR principles. The comprehensive data collection process provided the basis for the upcoming analysis of different management scenarios and formulation of priority mitigation actions that will inform future funding decisions of the project and the relevant authorities toward a long-term risk reduction strategy. Emphasis of analyses and planning efforts has been placed on specific vulnerabilities of different social groups so that corresponding specific protection measures help reduce the unacceptable fatalities to the lowest possible levels and address social inclusion challenges.

1. The Upper Vardar Flood Risk Management Plan is completed along with priority short- and long-term flood risk mitigation investments 2. Harmonization of the existing municipal flood defense plans with the newly prepared Upper Vardar Flood Risk Management Plan is initiated 3. Priority areas are selected for the demonstration of risk-sensitive urban/development planning 4. Priority urban resilience interventions are conceptualized and designed providing basis for future investments

As the project was launched at the end of 2017, no targets were set for 2018.
Project implementation and activities are from 2018 onward.

1. Meteorological and hydrological monitoring network is operationalized in the Polog region as a basis for the future floods 2. Priority ecosystem-based flood risk mitigation measures are conceptualized and designed providing basis for their future implementation 3. Preparation of the national-level flood risk mitigation strategy and action is launched 4. Possibilities for advancing the risk financing and risk transfer options are explored and implementation priorities of the project are defined

- rebuild new kindergarten

comment.narrative: - destroyed only facility for children in the only Roma municipality in the country
- Preliminary and Basic Design of the new kindergarten

The project will redesign and rebuild the facility to create a safer, warmer and disability-friendly environment that will be easier to maintain and less expensive to operate (including through energy-efficiency improvements) and adhere to the latest standards for indoor and outdoor structures. It will also expand capacity by providing for nursery care of children between 9-24 months – a new service that will give local parents more time for employment. In 2017, the preliminary and basic design has been developed for the new facility in the municipality of Shuto Orizari. In addition, Czech TF has allocated funds for development of Energy Efficiency plan to the developed design.
